page.title: 02Leighton Hall
page.content: A mid-victorian mansion built for a banker is now for sale.There was once an old Tudor hall on the same site.Leighton hall was owned by an American senator,and it was recently used for television films e.g.Blott on the landscape, and East Lynne. This beautiful Hall was once used as a private school.Its interior has decorated woodwork,carved ceilings,marble sculptures,galleries and chandeliers.No expense was spared when it was built.It was designed by the architect W.H. Gee,and the interior by Pugin.There is a 100 foot carillon tower in this listed building.The grounds are well-kept still,and we went to the annual church fete held there last Saturday.This is a pleasent and beautiful place.
